Richmond Opera Hotel
7.7 Very good
Based on 119 reviews

The Richmond Opera Hotel has a very good location about 5 blocks away from the Opera Garnier. We were very impressed by the sitting room and bar just beyond the reception - the period decoration from the early 1900s is tasteful and the stained-glass ceiling is beautiful.

Our standard room was spacious and comfortable. It included all the amenities we expected - flat-screen TV with international programming, mini-bar with refrigerator, safety-deposit box, and even complimentary coffee and tea. All staff members charmingly went out of their way to be of service. When we made the booking, we requested early check-in. Our room was not ready when we arrived around 10:00 AM or so, and the receptionist promptly registered us and took care of our luggage so that we were expected when we returned later in the day. We were very satisfied with our experience, and would love to return to this hotel!

Show more
Gunther , Mexico
Hotel Chavanel
8.7 Excellent
Based on 192 reviews

Hotel Chavanel is too small for a 4 stars hotel but undeniably it's a charming small boutique hotel. Great location with all the big department stores ard the area and metro station is just 3 mins walk away.

The hotel only have 1 small lift so it's a really small hotel but lovely and clean room. Room is very comfortable. I have nothing to complain about the room except it a little small but we are informed of the room size before we book it. The stuff wasn't very helpful and a bit confused as the day we left the hotel, we informed the front desk that we already booked the transport to airport (thru the hotel in fact!), and we are expecting the transport. Then a shuttle van stop in front of the hotel and asked if someone is waiting for transport to airport and the front desk told the driver "no!". I was right in front of the receiption desk and overheard the conversation (in French). Not that I understand French but I do understand that "non!". Driver look confused and I can see the paper he was holding written my room number. I then tell him oh yes I am expecting a transport to airport. I am shocked how unprofessional how the receitionist was and we just just inform her we are expecting a transport to the airport 5 mins before the van arrived, and we're just standing in front of the front desk. She is not rude but I just don't understand. Perhaps she is just being ignorant.

Show more
Moo , Malaysia
Hotel Angely Paris
8.3 Excellent
Based on 36 reviews

Overall quite nice (considering what you usually get for your money in Paris). However, the breakfast was comedic to be polite.

Tiny space with 6 tables and self service, although half the time there was nothing to serve yourself with. Cutlery was non existent, I served the waiting people myself on one morning as they were getting disgruntled. Nothing was refilled, unless you asked and then only half filled at best. The staff seemed completely unable to cope with 6 tables, poor manager was getting very frustrated with the kitchen staff. Don't get me wrong, I enjoyed my stay and the breakfast when available was alright, just so many basic errors in how to run a breakfast station it was a French Fawlty Towers - I suggest sitting back and watching it unfold like a farce in the west end.

Show more
Gary , United Kingdom
Le Burgundy Hotel
9.2 Exceptional
Based on 53 reviews

le burgundy hotel is in a really fantastic location, absolutely central to everything. we walked to all the sightseeing places with ease.

the metro (subway) is less than 100m. the hotel is superb,exquiste and so luxurious. like many rooms in paris it is more expensive than we may be used to in australia but it offered the true experience of what i hoped my first trip to paris would be. the hotel staff were helpful, friendly and welcoming. just a glance in their direction and they were ready to assist with any query you may have. did i mention how divine the rooms were....really beautiful and our looked at in to the central courtyard. it was very quite and one morining we slept through to 11am as the luxurious velvet curtains blocked out all light. the spa an swimming pool are sublime, hues of blue, lounges, towels and newspapers all on hand. if you want to experience paris the way it should be seen, start by staying here. it will fulfill your parisian dream.

Show more
Simone , Australia
Best Western Premier Kapital Opera
8.6 Excellent
Based on 180 reviews

This was my third time staying in this hotel, overall was good. However, I am disappointed to their after-sale-service.

I booked a taxi through hotel to airport. The front desk told me the night before the taxi fare would be €55, so I gave the same amount to the driver. The driver was not able to give me the receipt when I took off, but sent by email afterward. Later I checked email and discovered the price was €45. I called the driver immediately when I was still in airport, who committed to follow-up. After I returned to HK, I wrote email twice to driver, no feedback is received, neither feedback from hotel even I sent emails to them twice, they should have connection with that driver, but offered no hands on this case, I am very disappointed on their service.

Show more
Ka , Hong Kong
Hotel Napoleon
8.2 Excellent
Based on 69 reviews

Wonderful Staff, great breakfast and a room with a view. Yes it's expensive for a family but the location is right at the Arc de Triumph and it's metro station.

The Champs-Elysees is very pretty at night however the shops are crowded and the area feels run down. Cleanliness very good. The Staff are very friendly, helpful and polite. There is a lounge and lobby area. Not sure of any others during our stay however we came to see Paris and not the hotel facilities. We would consider staying in a hotel with pool next time.

Show more
Dr , United Kingdom
Le Grand Hotel de Normandie
8 Very good
Based on 623 reviews

HOTEL COND/CLEANLINESS: hotel is in very good condition at the time of my stay(Sept 2014).it's fairly new&everything is clean to the point of almost spotless.

it even has automatic doors at the entrance(locked late at night for security purpose,but the receptionist will open the door for hotel guest).the lobby is small but that's not a prob for me.Lift is available LOCATION: Location couldnt be better than this:it's situated at the side of St Lazare (10steps away from Rue de Amsterdam exit of St Lazare).St Lazare is a very big metro/subway/bus station with many connecting lines.So if you're planning to travel around with metro/subway,this hotel is perfect for u ROOM COMFORT: the room is very clean&new as well,including all the facilities,bed,bathroom.the facilities provided are heater,hair dryer,air cond,plasma tv,free WiFi.No complimentary mineral water is provided though,but it's not a prob because there's a supermarket nearby(Carrefour City in St Lazare).the room that we lived in had a direct view of St Lazare,which is a beautiful scenery.often,we bought some breakfast&coffee&just went back to the hotel,sat in front of the window&enjoyed our meal there with the cool breeze basking us.beats eating at a busy cafe STAFF PERFORMANCE: Staff performance is great as everyone commands proper English.We dont speak a word of French&we manage to get by just fine.They are friendly&helpful.One of them even helped us to press the button for the lift when they saw us entering the main entrance from outside so that we dont have to wait so long for the lift to arrive.a big thumbs up VALUE FOR MONEY: the price for the hotel is considered reasonable&very much value for money.we made some research on a number of hotels&decided to give this a try because of the location&price.it's well worth it CONCLUSION: this hotel is definitely to look out for if you're looking for a value-for-money, clean, modern, easy access & friendly-English-speaking-staff hotel

Show more
Alen , Malaysia
Best Western Premier Le Swann
7.7 Very good
Based on 296 reviews

First impressions weren't great as the front-desk and back-office areas were undergoing renovation and temporarily crammed into the small lounge.

The room we booked wasn't available so we were upgraded to an executive suite which was nice. Although initial initially disappointed by the size of the room, we quickly began to appreciate the many good things about this hotel. The room was newly renovated and spotless, with good quality sheets and comfortable mattress. The shower, air-con and Nespresso coffee machine all worked great and the free Wi-Fi was fast and reliable. The only problem we had was with the washbasin plug. There was no way to unplug it to let the water drain out. However that was quickly fixed upon notification to the front-desk staff. Breakfast was an extra cost option at €9 net and turned out to be quite a substantial buffet spread that included a variety of cold cut meats as well as hot items such as scrambled eggs and pork sausages. There wasn't an over-abundance of items, but whatever was offered was high quality. Staff were attentive and friendly despite the disruption from the builders working all around them. The front-office staff spoke good English and dealt with all our requests efficiently, from borrowing an adapter for UK appliances and an umbrella to getting the washbasin plug fixed. The hotel is located in a quiet neighbourhood which felt safe at night. There isn't much of interest for tourists in the immediate vicinity, but the location makes a good base. It's centrally located between the fashionable restaurants and bars of the 17th arr. to the west, Montmatre to the NE, the main shopping district of Bvd. Haussmann to the SE and to the south, the river Seine and museums. Not forgetting the nearest Metro station (Europe) which is just 2 mins walk from the hotel. All-in-all we had a very pleasant stay at this hotel which although small, lives-up to its claim of being 'elegant' and has the stamp of quality throughout.

Show more
Martin , Malaysia
Shangri-La Hotel, Paris
9.5 Exceptional
Based on 20 reviews

Hotel California Champs Elysees
8.2 Excellent
Based on 206 reviews

We booked the deluxe room, it is a very comfortable big room with a big windows that you can see the garden restaurant.

Bathroom is large, enough for 2 people to use at the same time. Air-conditioning is good, no need to worry if you are from tropical countries. Water pot is available inside the room, you can make hot tea or coffee by yourself. There is ice machine provided in the public corridor, you can make cold drink if you like. Wifi is fast in room. Great location, 2 mins to Zara, H&M, LV and other shops in Champs Elysees. 5 mins to the Metro. Location is really really great - convenient in the busy area but not noisy. 2-3 stars Michelin restaurants are available nearby. Staff are friendly & helpful except night shift staff - we asked for service few times but got no follow up or reply. Daytime staff are very sincere and good communication skills. We booked the hotel thru Agoda with good price. Highly recommended!!!! Taxi from hotel to airport (CDG) only cost 46 euro (with slightly jam in the city center).

Show more
WONG , Hong Kong
Hotel Bourg Tibourg
8.9 Excellent
Based on 67 reviews

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this little charming hotel. The staff are great, kind and helpful at all times.

They were also very sweet in that they left a note to wish us well for our weddding anniversary, and they also offered a nice bowl of fresh strawberries and raspberries. The location of the hotel is unbeatable, especially if you want to explore this fantastic neighbourhood which is the Marais, with plenty of quirky shops, world class museums, great bars and restaurants. The hotel is tastefully decorated and well kept, which makes one's stay very pleasant. Rooms are on the small side (still this is Paris where hotel rooms seem to average on the small side, so...), but there is all you need to spend a good and relaxing time. Breakfast is normally not included in the room's price and come at 20 Euros per person, so despite being very nice quality if you want to go for something quick (e.g. Cappuccino and croissant only) you'd better go to one of the many bars nearby. The rooms as well are not cheap but I guess Paris and the Marais are in general not cheap either so I believe Bourg Tibourg is definitely a good choice if you want to fully enjoy such a level of service and comfort.

Show more
Michele , Italy
West End Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 91 reviews

Hotel was what I expected it to be. Super location, classy without being pretentious, nice and friendly staff, very nicely decorated and elegant.

We had a lovely room and very spacious. But I cannot speak about the other rooms in general. We did not have a nice view and if we opened the windows we could hear the machinery working, that was annoying. Breakfast was nice, but room for eating was really small/tiny and if you wanted eggs, they were extra (5 Euros/order) even though we had breakfast included in our room rate - stingy!

Show more
Eni , Switzerland
Hotel Balzac Champs Elysees Paris
8.3 Excellent
Based on 57 reviews

Paid a premium 5 star price for this Hotel for my partners birthday as a romantic weekend away. Room airconditioning was stuck on full heat when we arrived, asked the Hotel to rectify.

Went out for dinner and when we came back the airconditioning was disabled completely and no explaination offered. The bathroom smelt of mold and mildew and was not of the standard I would expect for a 5 star hotel. Went out on the following day to come back to find the door being ajar and not closed properly. The room now smelt of vinegar from the attempted cleaning of the mold/mildew. Found the cleaning staff had thrown out some of our belongings from the bathroom. Only after multiple visits to reception were we offered an alternative room. The new room was much cleaner and what would be expected for a Hotel of this standard. Staff ignored a Do Not Disturb sign on the door and cleaned room after we explicitly asked them not to enter. Only after my partner complained (as it was her birthday) and asked for compensation were we sent complimentary Champaign for the numerous issues we encountered.

Show more
Carl , New Zealand
Hotel Marignan Champs Elysees
8.8 Excellent
Based on 41 reviews

We loved our stay at this hotel, a gem! Pros: - Location, location, location....right in middle of the golden triangle, Champs Élysées, Ave Montaigne and Ave George.

Great for shopping and plenty of restaurants. -The room is done up in modern luxe, with all the trimmings and modern amenities; comfortable bedding, iPod/ iPad station, 40 inch flat screen TV, light dimmer, Free WiFi services. - The staffs was helpful, and accommodating. Helped with our dinner reservation and travelling arrangement. 5 stars service! - The ambience of the hotel exudes an air home comfort with unassuming, private and relax feels. - Turn down services, room services and the best is a free minibar for guests. Cons: - Our room ac wasn't working but we had a bay window that open up to the courtyard, we had the cold winter breeze coming thru so it was quite nice to snuggled up in our bed. The hotel met our expectations and more, we are already making plans to return to Paris and staying here..

Show more
Aishah , Malaysia
Mercure Paris Centre Tour Eiffel
7.9 Very good
Based on 421 reviews

It was a very good experience with friendly staff members. Moving around Paris is easy with a few metro lines within walking distance from the hotel.

Note that if you sit in a train/subway for more than 15mins, change route! So it's helpful to have an alternative route on hand. We had two incidences with RER C line: First time, we missed our reservation time at a Michelin restaurant and second time was a close-shave - We nearly missed our flight as we sat waiting in RER C line and couldn't understand French announcements and those who could understand French near us at that time, gave wrong advice. Luckily we had a French SIM card, searched Google maps after over 30 mins of waiting, and went on alternative route via metro line 6 - RER B. It was made worse when the RER B train we were on stopped at terminal 1 when we need to go to terminal 2 - so we had to get off (with help of a French student who translated the announcement) and wait for next RER B train. We were also lucky to meet with a kind airport officer who said "ohh la la" when she saw our flight time and zoomed us via express lanes. Overall great experience but just need to be prepared with contingencies. :-)

Show more
Jenny , Singapore
Best Western Premier Opera Faubourg
7.8 Very good
Based on 371 reviews

We arrived to Paris after a ten hour flight, nine hour time change and two hour delay, due to a lockdown at the airport.

I'm five months pregnant and we desperately needed a rest and quiet. The BW Premier Opera Faubourg offered the perfect stay for our weary, jet-lagged souls. We're pretty adventurous travelers that move around a lot after arrival and like things simple with a restful, clean environment, not luxurious, over-the-top glamour. The room was cool, modern, clean, with two twin beds--our preference--a desk and plenty of closet space. The bathroom was crystal clean with plenty of consistent, hot water. The black out curtains provided darkness for small naps to ease jet-lag and pregnancy induced exhaustion. The air con offered personalized climate control. Staff was friendly and helpful. They even called to double-check whether I wanted the room cleaned at the end of the day when I decided to nap during cleaning. They weren't overly pushy though. The breakfast was a combination between English and French, with a ton of pastry, dairy, protein, fruit and beverage options. A little pricy, but a nice way to start the day, especially when you're used to a substantial breakfast. One of our favorite elements was the neighborhood. The proximity to a main metro station was ideal. We took the metro from the airport and made it to the hotel in less than five minutes from the closest station. There are a couple groceries, pharmacies and many restaurants nearby. The area seemed relatively affluent with many well-dressed and friendly locals bustling about. The streets were clean and safe, the architecture lovely and the restaurants and cafes delicious. We adored walking around and people watching. There seemed to be something open for dining at all reasonable times of the day--morning through midnight. We'd stay again in a heartbeat--especially for the deal we snagged off Agoda.

Show more
Malen , United States
Hotel de Castiglione
6.9 Good
Based on 230 reviews

first day I went in, the hotel reserved a deluxe room for me while I reserved a standard room, which was excellent, but I asked for a high floor, and they gave me a second floor with no view, and the corridor was under renovation.

When I arrived, I asked to change the room, and the person who answered was good, and came to change within the floor, and after I told him no, he offered me a room on the 6th floor (as I requested, and they told me there are no rooms in upper floors). The room was in good shape, newly redecorated, and had a good view. I even liked the fact that the toilette and the bath were separated by a wall. Downsides were as stated by others, safe can be removed from its place (but I found the same thing in Marriott Courtyard Toulouse), there were no doors for the closet, and TV is a bit old. Another thing, when I asked for an adapter for the electrical plug, they asked me to purchase one, this is a service that should be available in a four star hotel

Show more
Tamer , Jordan
Hotel Scribe Paris Opera by Sofitel
8.8 Excellent
Based on 71 reviews

an excellent choice for us. the room was modern and comfortable. in room amenities were great and breakfast was good.

the restaurant there also had great food and desserts. not too far from chopping area and near to auber rer. very convenient indeed. we will return definitely!

Show more
Vorachand , Thailand
Marquis Faubourg St Honore Relais & Chateaux
8.9 Excellent
Based on 17 reviews

Maison Albar Hotel Paris Céline
9.7 Exceptional
Based on 4 reviews

Le Marceau Bastille Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 127 reviews

Le Marceau Bastille Hotel was really ideal for our 3 day stay in Paris. Getting around to everywhere else while we were there was a snap, as the hotel is in easy walking distance from Gare de Lyon, Gare D'Austerlitz and the Bastille metro stop.

The area it's in is pretty quiet, and PACKED with restaurants. Also a bonus. The hotel staff were very friendly, and spoke excellent English. They were helpful and courteous and always there when we needed them. The room itself was lovely. There were chocolates on our bed when we arrived. It was neat, peaceful, well-kept and relatively roomy, considering it's Paris. The bathroom was separate, private and had a full bath/shower. It's a pretty small hotel, with only a few floors, and not that many rooms per floor. So, it wasn't too crazy either. Nice if you like having less of a crowd around you. The art exhibit on the main floor/lobby was delightful. I understand they show different artists throughout the year. We never got breakfast at the hotel, so I can't speak to that. The only minor disappointment was the "gym". It was in the basement, which was surprisingly warm, stuffy and not well-ventilated. And the equipment was pretty sub-standard. I used one machine for 20 minutes, and it squeaked the whole time. No treadmill. Just a bike, a quasi-elliptical, a sit up bench, and maybe one other thing in there? So, if you're looking for a hotel with a gym (which I was), you'll probably be disappointed there. But I can't say I was surprised. I've found some American hotels equally shabby for what the qualify as a "gym". We picked up our stay for a bargain ($150/nt when factoring in taxes and fees). But I've paid much more for less at other stays, and would probably pay more for these accommodations in the future. Thanks for the great visit, Le Marceau Bastille!

Show more
Sharon , United States
InterContinental Paris Le Grand
8.4 Excellent
Based on 92 reviews

We arrived early in the morning from a long flight, it's unusual to be given a room but to our surprise we were shown to a room with a view of the roof tops of Paris.

I think being a "Ambassador" member of the Intercontinental chain of hotels is a huge advantage, we use it and highly recommend it at US$150 per year, it pays for itself in so many ways. We opted for the hop on hop off tourist bus which gave us 2 days ( which begin and end in a day, not a 24 hour period as some do ) to see the sights, great way around, hotel sells the tickets as they do for so many things in PAris. This hotel must rate in the top 5 hotels in Paris, style, service, food and as I expect from this type of hotel, an eye for detail, bravo everyone.

7.1 Very good
Based on 171 reviews

Before I went to Paris with my gf I read a lot of very worrying reviews of this hotel. When I arrived I was given the key to room 201.

Nervously I entered the room but to my surprise the room was actually fine. Yes, the furniture is old and the hallways are not the most level floors I've ever walked on but when we went to Paris we wanted a room that we could come back to for a rest after a long day out sightseeing. The room itself was quite large for a room in Paris with very high ceilings. The paint in the bathtub is chipped and the carpet has seen better days but those are probably the only negative aspects I experienced. Other rooms may be in a worse condition but room 201 is absolutely fine. Paris can leave you empty pocketed but if I do ever return I would have no issue staying here again. Plenty of restaurant and bars (€9.50 for a pint) nearby and the Louvre is literally outside your window.

I love the Guilded Lounge Suite I stayed, which was one of the rooms designed my Martin Margiela under the Suite Couture collection.

I emailed the hotel for this room specifically (they have 4 different designs) and I'm happy they reserved it for me. The staff speaks English well, friendly and helpful. The room is spacious, with a very comfortable bed. There are free movies, big screen Mac computer with wifi and Nespresso machine. The food is good especially the Sunday brunch at La Table du 8 restaurant. Mostly, I enjoyed the design of the room and the whole hotel, the simplicity but with great amount of details. The location is on a quite street but very close to luxury shopping and Champs Elyesees. I visited the Grand Palais, which had a great Dynamo L'Exposition and it was just 5 mins walk from the hotel. The grand Palais cafe across the hotel is a good substitute for lunch and tea time. Great experience for something different and would definitely recommend to others.

The rate which I paid for this room did not worth what I had expected and what I had paid for!! It was absolute disappointment.

As it was only my one night stay in Paris, I decided to pay for something better and more luxurious. However, when I went into the room, I was shocked that for the price which I had paid, even the most basic mineral water was not provided. It was charged 5 Euro per bottle which I could probably get a free bottle from a two star hotel. Come on, how much would a bottle of mineral water cost a hotel like Novotel. There weren't any bedroom slippers as well. Nothing extra was provided in the room, except soap, shower gel and shampoo. I read of the coffee making facilities in the Agoda review. Thinking it was really special, it was just a simple kettle and two sachets of Nescafe!!! Another attraction mentioned was the sofa bed. Well, no doubt there were two sofa beds provided, how much can a couple sleep on since there already provide a queen bed. Wouldn't it be ridiculuos to sleep on the two sofa beds (left and right of the room) instead of the bed? Above all, NO breakfast was provided!!! The location was not that great either. It was actually far from the famed Eiffel Tower and other attractions!! I will never stay in Novotel in Paris or in any other parts of the world!!!

I arrived in Paris early in the morning and I transfered straight to the hotel. Upon arriival, the receptionist was friendly and helped me through the check-in procedure but I was told that my room will only be ready at 2pm.

So, I was advised to wait at the lobby or to go out for some walk and returning to pick up my key after 2pm. I was so tired after long hours flight and so I decided to stay in the hotel lobby. They did not even serve a glass of water. I have been travelling to many places and Considering the rate is at the higher side, they should at least serve some soft drinks for their guest who waited for their rooms to be ready. The location of this hotel is good. Concorde metro station is about 5 minutes walk away. Since the hotel is near to the US embassy, the street is closed sometimes and so no vehicle is allowed to enter. You will need to take other route even if you are walking. I was expecting the worst after reading the comments from various travellers but was really surprised with the service we received.

We stayed here on 22nd September 2015. We were surprised to receive a valet parking service (though expensive-parking was 50 EUR per day) as we didn't receive this at any other hotels in Europe in our entire stay (referring to Ramada Encore - Vienna, Ramada (Switzerland), and Radisson Blu - Disneyland). So that was brilliant and they took our luggages to the room too. I would say excellent. Checkin staff Mr. Nishanta was very helpful and customer oriented. He made sure that we received the best view of Eiffel Tower by giving us a room on 29th floor. We were really happy with the service received. However, the hotel was a bit old and the room too had its minor problems. But if you take a close look at the pouch of your room card, you will see one more card from the management which clearly states that the hotel is undergoing a massive renovation for the next 18 months and is being done by George Wong Design of New York. So no complaints this time. But the beds and washrooms were clean. A mini bar was provided too. Room service was excellent. We had a great dinner in our room with the beautiful view of Eiffel Tower. I would say I made the right choice by selecting Hyatt. Overall we were really satisfied with the experience.

Traveler impressions of Paris

Paris is one of the most beautiful cities in the world. Its just a shame the French are sometimes a tad unfriendly, some are great but a few.

.. The highlights of our trip were a river cruise with Bateux Parisiens, visiting the Roden Musuem, The Eiffel Tower and its surrounds and shopping on the Champs Elysees! Despite our fears after the recent terror attacks, we saw no evidence of trouble, life has returned to normal in Paris and we really enjoyed the trip.

PECKETT ,United Kingdom

The metro is the best way to get around and if you know you will use it a lot get the 10 ticket pack or the Paris visit pass.

It is quick and easy to get around on the metro to all the museums and sights you want to visit. Stop anyplace and find a cafe or restaurant. It doesn't mater what area you are visiting or where your hotel is as long as you are near the Metro everything is easily within reach. Visiting the Louvre is a no brainer and may take more than one visit to be satisfied. One surprisingly interesting (although macabre) attraction for us wereThe Catacombs (the Paris Ossuary).

More about Paris

Paris is arguably the most recognizable city in the world. Renowned for its iconic beauty, the City of Lights sees a great number of visitors drawn to it year after year. In a word, Paris is simply stunning.

Divided by the river Seine and split into 20 districts, Paris's architectural beauty is its most obvious appeal. Building restrictions have frozen the inner city in the late 19th century. Add to that the world-famous sites such as the Arc de Triomphe, Louvre Museum, the Notre Dame, and the Eiffel Tower, it’s easy to see that Paris is overwhelmingly endowed with architectural marvels.

The birthplace of bohemianism, Paris treasures and nurtures art in all its forms. The Louvre stands out as a must-see for first-time visitors, the Centre Georges Pompidou a few streets away providing a modern counterpoint. The Musee D’Orsay is as much as a masterpiece as the art collections it houses of Monet, Van Gogh, and Renoir, to name a few.

Dinning in Paris is a cultural experience for all the senses, and the city’s sidewalks are filled with places to experience it just like the locals.

Paris is served by Charles de Gaulle Airport while the Eurostar to Brussels and London departs from Gare du Nord, and overnight connections to Italy depart from Gare de Lyon.

There's much more to see and learn about Paris, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to find out where all the attractions, hotels, and must-see destinations can be found in this exciting city.

Show more Alexander , Australia Nolinski Paris 9.3 Exceptional Based on 18 reviews Normandy Hotel 7.1 Very good Based on 171 reviews Before I went to Paris with my gf I read a lot of very worrying reviews of this hotel. When I arrived I was given the key to room 201. Nervously I entered the room but to my surprise the room was actually fine. Yes, the furniture is old and the hallways are not the most level floors I've ever walked on but when we went to Paris we wanted a room that we could come back to for a rest after a long day out sightseeing. The room itself was quite large for a room in Paris with very high ceilings. The paint in the bathtub is chipped and the carpet has seen better days but those are probably the only negative aspects I experienced. Other rooms may be in a worse condition but room 201 is absolutely fine. Paris can leave you empty pocketed but if I do ever return I would have no issue staying here again. Plenty of restaurant and bars (€9.50 for a pint) nearby and the Louvre is literally outside your window. Show more Barry , Ireland La Maison Champs Elysees 8.5 Excellent Based on 130 reviews I love the Guilded Lounge Suite I stayed, which was one of the rooms designed my Martin Margiela under the Suite Couture collection. I emailed the hotel for this room specifically (they have 4 different designs) and I'm happy they reserved it for me. The staff speaks English well, friendly and helpful. The room is spacious, with a very comfortable bed. There are free movies, big screen Mac computer with wifi and Nespresso machine. The food is good especially the Sunday brunch at La Table du 8 restaurant. Mostly, I enjoyed the design of the room and the whole hotel, the simplicity but with great amount of details. The location is on a quite street but very close to luxury shopping and Champs Elyesees. I visited the Grand Palais, which had a great Dynamo L'Exposition and it was just 5 mins walk from the hotel. The grand Palais cafe across the hotel is a good substitute for lunch and tea time. Great experience for something different and would definitely recommend to others. Show more Fatiha , Malaysia Novotel Paris Les Halles Hotel 8 Very good Based on 173 reviews The rate which I paid for this room did not worth what I had expected and what I had paid for!! It was absolute disappointment. As it was only my one night stay in Paris, I decided to pay for something better and more luxurious. However, when I went into the room, I was shocked that for the price which I had paid, even the most basic mineral water was not provided. It was charged 5 Euro per bottle which I could probably get a free bottle from a two star hotel. Come on, how much would a bottle of mineral water cost a hotel like Novotel. There weren't any bedroom slippers as well. Nothing extra was provided in the room, except soap, shower gel and shampoo. I read of the coffee making facilities in the Agoda review. Thinking it was really special, it was just a simple kettle and two sachets of Nescafe!!! Another attraction mentioned was the sofa bed. Well, no doubt there were two sofa beds provided, how much can a couple sleep on since there already provide a queen bed. Wouldn't it be ridiculuos to sleep on the two sofa beds (left and right of the room) instead of the bed? Above all, NO breakfast was provided!!! The location was not that great either. It was actually far from the famed Eiffel Tower and other attractions!! I will never stay in Novotel in Paris or in any other parts of the world!!! Upon arriival, the receptionist was friendly and helped me through the check-in procedure but I was told that my room will only be ready at 2pm. So, I was advised to wait at the lobby or to go out for some walk and returning to pick up my key after 2pm. I was so tired after long hours flight and so I decided to stay in the hotel lobby. They did not even serve a glass of water. I have been travelling to many places and Considering the rate is at the higher side, they should at least serve some soft drinks for their guest who waited for their rooms to be ready. The location of this hotel is good. Concorde metro station is about 5 minutes walk away. Since the hotel is near to the US embassy, the street is closed sometimes and so no vehicle is allowed to enter. You will need to take other route even if you are walking. I found the housekeeping staff are friendly but they have very little ability to communicate in English. It seems to be a problem when you are trying to seek for their assistance. Show more Perrine , Malaysia Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile 6.9 Good Based on 479 reviews I was expecting the worst after reading the comments from various travellers but was really surprised with the service we received. We stayed here on 22nd September 2015. We were surprised to receive a valet parking service (though expensive-parking was 50 EUR per day) as we didn't receive this at any other hotels in Europe in our entire stay (referring to Ramada Encore - Vienna, Ramada (Switzerland), and Radisson Blu - Disneyland). So that was brilliant and they took our luggages to the room too. I would say excellent. Checkin staff Mr. Nishanta was very helpful and customer oriented. He made sure that we received the best view of Eiffel Tower by giving us a room on 29th floor. We were really happy with the service received. However, the hotel was a bit old and the room too had its minor problems. But if you take a close look at the pouch of your room card, you will see one more card from the management which clearly states that the hotel is undergoing a massive renovation for the next 18 months and is being done by George Wong Design of New York. So no complaints this time. But the beds and washrooms were clean. A mini bar was provided too. Room service was excellent. We had a great dinner in our room with the beautiful view of Eiffel Tower. I would say I made the right choice by selecting Hyatt. Overall we were really satisfied with the experience. When check out only we know we are charging for €12 for 3 glass of water instead we only ask for 2 hot water for our cup noodles due to late arrival in hotel! P/s: tips for travel - always check on whether you will being charge and how much it will be charge for something extra upon your additional request. Show more Vincent ,Canada Discover the neighborhoods of Paris 8th - Champs Elysees 835 hotels 6th - Saint Germain - Luxembourg 650 hotels 3rd - Temple - Republique 646 hotels 4th - Centre Pompidou 633 hotels 16th - Trocadero 624 hotels 9th - Opera 620 hotels 2nd - Louvre - Bourse 618 hotels 15th - Tour Eiffel - Porte de Versailles 602 hotels 17th - Arc de Triomphe - Palais des Congres 582 hotels 18th - Sacre Coeur - Montmartre 548 hotels 7th - Tour Eiffel - Invalides 528 hotels 1st - Louvre - Chatelet 512 hotels 5th - Pantheon- Notre Dame 496 hotels 10th - Gare du Nord 493 hotels 11th - Bastille - Republique 451 hotels 14th - Tour Montparnasse 326 hotels 12th - Bercy - Gare de Lyon 238 hotels La Defense 206 hotels 13th - Place d'Italie 169 hotels Disneyland 135 hotels Find the Perfect Type of Accommodation Apartments in Paris 3996 Serviced Apartments in Paris 132 Guest Houses in Paris 104 Hostels in Paris 39 More about Paris Paris is arguably the most recognizable city in the world. Renowned for its iconic beauty, the City of Lights sees a great number of visitors drawn to it year after year. In a word, Paris is simply stunning. Divided by the river Seine and split into 20 districts, Paris's architectural beauty is its most obvious appeal. Building restrictions have frozen the inner city in the late 19th century. Add to that the world-famous sites such as the Arc de Triomphe , Louvre Museum , the Notre Dame, and the Eiffel Tower , it’s easy to see that Paris is overwhelmingly endowed with architectural marvels. The birthplace of bohemianism, Paris treasures and nurtures art in all its forms. The Louvre stands out as a must-see for first-time visitors, the Centre Georges Pompidou a few streets away providing a modern counterpoint. The Musee D’Orsay is as much as a masterpiece as the art collections it houses of Monet, Van Gogh, and Renoir, to name a few. Dinning in Paris is a cultural experience for all the senses, and the city’s sidewalks are filled with places to experience it just like the locals. Paris is served by Charles de Gaulle Airport while the Eurostar to Brussels and London departs from Gare du Nord , and overnight connections to Italy depart from Gare de Lyon . There's much more to see and learn about Paris, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to find out where all the attractions, hotels, and must-see destinations can be found in this exciting city.
